steps.title: Gather your ingredients.
steps.content: Gather your ingredients. You will need: 1 seedless watermelon Powdered sugar or honey to taste Cold water and ice cubes

steps.title: Place your watermelon on a cutting board.
steps.content: Place your watermelon on a cutting board. Peel the watermelon and slice it into 1" (2.5 cm) chunks using a sharp knife.

steps.title: Place the watermelon chunks into a bowl, into a rubber container or onto a plate.
steps.content: Place the watermelon chunks into a bowl, into a rubber container or onto a plate. Use a fork instead of using your hands to prevent messiness.

steps.title: Place the watermelon in a blender.
steps.content: Place the watermelon in a blender. Add powdered sugar or honey, if desired. Blend your watermelon chunks and sweetener and check the consistency. Add water for thinner juice and add ice cubes for thicker juice.

steps.title: Blend well until the juice is smooth.
steps.content: Blend well until the juice is smooth. Pour the juice over ice cubes in a tall glass. You can strain the juice, if you wish, to remove the pulp.

steps.title: Gather your ingredients.
steps.content: Gather your ingredients. You will need: 7 sprigs of mint Juice of 1 1/2 lemons 1 tablespoon of sugar 2 small seedless watermelons

steps.title: Cut the rinds off the watermelons.
steps.content: Cut the rinds off the watermelons. Slice the flesh into 1" (2.5 cm) chunks.

steps.title: Blend the chunks, mint, and lemon juice until the mixture is smooth.
steps.content: Blend the chunks, mint, and lemon juice until the mixture is smooth.

steps.title: Pour the watermelon mixture through a sieve and into a saucepan.
steps.content: Pour the watermelon mixture through a sieve and into a saucepan. Press down on the watermelon using a wooden spoon to release the most juice. Mix the juice with sugar.

steps.title: Heat your saucepan over a medium-low setting.
steps.content: Heat your saucepan over a medium-low setting. Bring the juice to a simmer, but don't allow it to boil.

steps.title: Continue simmering the juice.
steps.content: Continue simmering the juice. Taste it frequently to see how the flavors are developing. When the juice is ready, remove it from the heat and let it cool.

steps.title: Pour the juice into a container and chill it.
steps.content: Pour the juice into a container and chill it. Serve the chilled juice in a tall glass over ice. Garnish the juice with a mint leaf.

steps.title: Gather your ingredients.
steps.content: Gather your ingredients. For two people, you will need: 1 1-1/4 lb. (625 g) seedless watermelon 2 pomegranates 7 oz. (200 g) fresh raspberries Ice cubes

steps.title: Peel your watermelon and cut it into chunks.
steps.content: Peel your watermelon and cut it into chunks. Remove the seeds from your pomegranate, setting a few seeds aside for garnish.

steps.title: Place the watermelon flesh into a juicer or blender.
steps.content: Place the watermelon flesh into a juicer or blender. Add the pomegranate seeds and the raspberries, and blend the mixture until it is smooth.

steps.title: Pour the juice into a tall glass over ice cubes.
steps.content: Pour the juice into a tall glass over ice cubes. Float some pomegranate seeds and raspberries on top of the juice for garnish.

steps.title: Wash the watermelon well.
steps.content: Wash the watermelon well. Remove dirt or blemishes.

steps.title: Peel a seedless watermelon.
steps.content: Peel a seedless watermelon.

steps.title: Separate the rind from the flesh of the watermelon.
steps.content: Separate the rind from the flesh of the watermelon. Chop it up.

steps.title: Put the chopped pieces of watermelon rind into the blender.
steps.content: Put the chopped pieces of watermelon rind into the blender. Blend until it reaches the desired consistency. Add water if needed.

steps.title: Serve and enjoy!
steps.content: Serve and enjoy!
